Class TileEdge

java.lang.Object
  TileEdge

public class TileEdge
extends java.lang.Object

Edge consisting of three adjacent tiles on the board of the maze. It is required for the maze generation algorithm.

Author:
Gavin Tam

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a tile edge.

Constructor Detail

TileEdge

public TileEdge(Tile t0,
                Tile t1,
                Tile t2)
Constructs a tile edge.

Parameters:
t0 - the tile marking one of the two endpoints of the edge.
t1 - the middle tile of the tile edge.
t2 - the tile marking the other endpoint of the edge.
Method Detail

containsTile

public boolean containsTile(Tile t)
Checks if the tile edge contains a particular tile.

Parameters:
t - the tile of interest.
Returns:
true if the tile is contained in the tile edge.

getTile0

public Tile getTile0()
Gets the tile marking one of the two endpoints of the edge.

Returns:
the tile making one of the two endpoints of the edge.

getTile1

public Tile getTile1()
Gets the middle tile of the edge.

Returns:
the middle tile of the edge.

getTile2

public Tile getTile2()
Gets the tile marking the other endpoint of the edge. See getTile0().

Returns:
the tile marking the other endpoint of the edge.

showEdge

public void showEdge()
Display the edge by printing the coordinates of the two endpoint tiles, t0 and t2.

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Override method for hashCode. Two tile edges have the same hashcode if they are equal. See override method for equals.

Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the hashcode of the tile edge.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Override method for equals. Two tile edges are equals if they share the same tiles, that is the tiles on the endpoints are the same (regardless of order), and the middle tile is identical.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
